text.*:
This is a list of wars fought by independent Bolivia from 1809 to 1967.

Part of a series on the
History of Bolivia
  • Overview
  • Pre-Columbian Bolivia
  • 1532–1809
  • 1809–1920
  • 1920–1964
  • 1964–1982
  • 1982–present
Bolivia portal
  • v
  • t
  • e
Conflict Combatant 1 Combatant 2 Results
Bolivian War of Independence
(1809-1825) 		Republiquetas
United Provinces 		 Spain Victory
  • Independence of Bolivia from Spanish rule.
Salaverry-Santa Cruz War
(1835-1836) 		 Bolivia  Peru Victory
  • Creation of the Peru-Bolivian Confederation.
War of the Confederation
(1836-1839) 		 Peru-Bolivia Confederacy  Chile
 Peru
 Argentina 		Defeat
  • Dissolution of the confederation.
Peruvian-Bolivian War
(1841–1842) 		 Bolivia  Peru Victory
  • Bolivia remains independent.
Chincha Islands War
(1866) 		 Peru
 Chile
 Ecuador
 Bolivia 		Spain Victory
  • Spanish withdrawal from the Chincha Islands.
  • Peru's independence recognized by Spain.
War of the Pacific
(1879-1883) 		 Peru
 Bolivia 		 Chile Defeat
  • Litoral Department ceded by Bolivia to Chile.
Chiriguano War
(1892) 		 Bolivia Chiriguano Victory
  • Subjugation of the chiriguano people.
Acre War
(1899–1903) 		 Bolivia Brazil
 Acre 		Defeat
  • Capitulation of Bolivian troops in Acre.
Chaco War
(1932-1935) 		 Bolivia  Paraguay

Supported by:
 United States[1]

Defeat
  • Most of the disputed area awarded to Paraguay.
Ñancahuazú Guerrilla
(1966–1967) 		 Bolivia
United States 		ELN
 Cuba 		Victory
  • Guerilla defeated, Che Guevara executed.

References[edit]

  1. ^ Mora, Frank o. and Cooney, Jerry Wilson (2007) Paraguay and the United States: Distant Allies. University of Georgia Press, p. 84. ISBN 0820324671
